00274 #ifndef _PGF_FILE_H
00275 #define _PGF_FILE_H
00276 
00277 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00278 //
00279 #include "util/Err.h"
00280 //
00281 
00282 namespace affx {
00283   class PgfFile;
00284 };
00285 
00289 class affx::PgfFile {
00290 public:
00291 #ifndef SWIG
00293   affx::TsvFile m_tsv;
00294 #endif
00295   // There isnt a "m_" prefix on these, as I want to seperate them out
00296   // from the "real" member variables. This will make it
00297   // easy for people to write "pgf.atom_id".
00298   // (No annoying prefix.)
00299 
00300   //#%header0=
00301   int probeset_id;            
00302   std::string probeset_type;  
00303   std::string probeset_name;  
00304   //#%header1=
00305   int atom_id;                
00306   //#%header2=
00307   int probe_id;               
00308   std::string probe_type;     
00309   int gc_count;               
00310   int probe_length;           
00311   int interrogation_position; 
00312   std::string probe_sequence; 
00313   int exon_position;          
00314 
00316   PgfFile() {
00317     probeset_id = -1;
00318     probeset_type = "";
00319     probeset_name = "";
00320     atom_id = -1;
00321     probe_id = -1;
00322     probe_type = "";
00323     gc_count = -1;
00324     probe_length = -1;
00325     interrogation_position = -1;
00326     probe_sequence = "";
00327     makePgfBindings();
00328   }
00329 
00331   ~PgfFile() {
00332   }
00333 
00335   void makePgfBindings() {
00336     // start afresh
00337     m_tsv.unbindAll();
00338     //#%header0=
00339     m_tsv.bind(0,"probeset_id",&probeset_id,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00340     m_tsv.bind(0,"type",&probeset_type);
00341     m_tsv.bind(0,"probeset_name",&probeset_name);
00342     //#%header1="
00343     m_tsv.bind(1,"atom_id",&atom_id,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00344     //#%header2=
00345     m_tsv.bind(2,"probe_id",&probe_id,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00346     m_tsv.bind(2,"type",&probe_type);
00347     m_tsv.bind(2,"gc_count",&gc_count);
00348     m_tsv.bind(2,"probe_length",&probe_length);
00349     m_tsv.bind(2,"interrogation_position",&interrogation_position);
00350     m_tsv.bind(2,"probe_sequence",&probe_sequence);
00351     // this seems to be unused...
00352     // m_tsv.bind(2,"exon_position",&exon_position);
00353   }
00357   int open(const std::string& filename) {
00358     std::string val;
00359     int rc = m_tsv.open(filename);
00360     if(rc == TSV_OK) {
00361       int rv=m_tsv.getHeader("pgf_format_version",val);
00362       Err::check(rv==TSV_OK,"No pgf_format_version header in pgf file");
00363       Err::check(val.compare("1.0")==0,"Unable to handle pgf file format");
00364     }
00365     return rc;
00366   }
00370   int write(const std::string& filename) {
00371     return m_tsv.writeTsv(filename);
00372   }
00375   int close() {
00376     return m_tsv.close();
00377   }
00380   int rewind() {
00381     return m_tsv.rewind();
00382   }
00385   int next_probeset() {
00386     return m_tsv.nextLevel(0);
00387   }
00390   int next_atom() {
00391     return m_tsv.nextLevel(1);
00392   }
00395   int next_probe() {
00396     return m_tsv.nextLevel(2);
00397   }
00401   int defineFilePgf(TsvFile* tsv) {
00402     Err::check(tsv!=NULL,"affx::PgfFile - no tsv file provided to defineFilePgf");
00403     // note embedded "\t"s and "\n"s.
00404     return tsv->defineFile("probeset_id\ttype\tprobeset_name\n"
00405                            "atom_id\n"
00406                            "probe_id\ttype\tgc_count\tprobe_length\t" // line break for length.
00407                            "interrogation_position\tprobe_sequence\texon_position\n");
00408   }
00411   int defineFilePgf() {
00412     return defineFilePgf(&m_tsv);
00413   }
00414 
00417   affx::TsvFile* tsv_ptr() {
00418     return &m_tsv;
00419   }
00420 };
00421 
00422 #endif // TsvFile
